column1: Copied to main database by Kim/Bill

column45: PFF stream flowing, drain pipe flow
PPU very high tide and waves
pH probe not placed in KCL leaving OLP
PLH - had been flowing but stopped
PFF - moderate flow 40 ft north of usual location
PLT 1.5 inch of mucky silt on bottom
Increasing amounts of a brown algae on rocks in water surrounding pier
Heavy rains carved sand by culvert and there was still a light flow
MB sampled all 6 sites, CM sampled only OLP and OSF, No rain in last 24 hours, stream flowing
MB sampled all 6 sites, CM sampled only OLP and OSF, No rain in last 24 hours, water flowing through tube from street forming 'pond' on beach but not going into ocean
MB sampled all 6 sites, CM sampled only OLP and OSF, No rain in last 24 hours
MB sampled all 6 sites, CM sampled only OLP and OSF, No rain in last 24 hours
MB sampled all 6 sites, CM sampled only OLP and OSF, No rain in last 24 hours
MB sampled all 6 sites, CM sampled only OLP and OSF, No rain in last 24 hours
storm drain not flowing. Lots of dogs on beach
Had to walk out very far to get knee deep - 2 dogs in water
Aldo jumped in next to sampler to take pictures
Very low tide, hard to sample without kicking up sediment
First turbidity reading was low and group took 4 more readings.
Seal nearby; Stream stonger than usual
Drainage by PLH was more than 3/4 filled with large sticks and derbies.  (see photos - James has photos)
The san in teh water is unusually loose which allowed Rich to sink 6 or so inches at PLH and PLT.
18 on beach for PFF is approx number.
PFF stream path is about 30ft north of the normal path
PLT - 2 monk seals were frolicking approx. 40ft to the right of our sample path.  Rich had to walk about 90ft from shore and 30ft beyond the seals.
Olowalu Pier not sampled at all due to miscommunication
OSF - low DO reading - rechecked meter log
PFF - steady flow of stream at 505 Front St (regular)
PLH - culvert blocked by sand, 5% cloud cover, no wind
OSF - waves (0.5') passing over reef because of high tide
PLH - drainage is still totally covered,  outrigger in water w/5 people
PLT - 4th tubidity reading 1.82,  1 possibly 2 monk seals in water, high cirrus clouds, steady Kona wind
